fields.description:
bq. Under certain conditions, commit issue comments may appear a second time when merging a pull request. The person who merged the pull request will appear as the author of this comment.


bq. An issue shouldn't be transitioned again, nor should there be a message, if the issue is already in the transition status.


bq. The person shown to have performed the action is technically accurate as we log all comments to the person who either pushed the commit containing the message, or the person who performed the action on the Bitbucket site.


Recreating issue because BCLOUD-10802 was closed due to inactivity.
fields.summary: Issue commit comments are processed again when merging (BB-11792)

fields.description:
I've been having issues for the past few days where cloning or pulling on a repository with public read access keeps asking for username and password to bitbucket.

This used to work flawlessly, but now it's a hit-and-miss.  I have tried to figure out what makes it do this... it's happening on about 4/5 of my attempts.  This is the output I usually get on the shell

{code}
fatal: could not read Username for 'http://bitbucket.org': No such device or address

{code}

After this, it normally asks for username and password, which should not be needed to clone a public repository.

My clone URL is http://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git

Here is a snippet of a terminal session where I cloned it.  You can see here how many attempts it took to clone it.  The same command was repeated time after time... it failed many times.

{code:bash}
vlocity:/~/devel
vluser:$ rm -rf vl72; git clone http://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git
Cloning into 'vl72'...
Username for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
Password for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git/'
vlocity:/~/devel
vluser:$ rm -rf vl72; git clone http://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git
Cloning into 'vl72'...
Username for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
Password for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git/'
vlocity:/~/devel
vluser:$ rm -rf vl72; git clone http://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git
Cloning into 'vl72'...
Username for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
Password for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git/'
vlocity:/~/devel
vluser:$ rm -rf vl72; git clone http://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git
Cloning into 'vl72'...
Username for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
Password for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git/'
vlocity:/~/devel
vluser:$ rm -rf vl72; git clone http://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git
Cloning into 'vl72'...
Username for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
Password for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git/'
vlocity:/~/devel
vluser:$ rm -rf vl72; git clone http://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git
Cloning into 'vl72'...
Username for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
Password for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git/'
vlocity:/~/devel
vluser:$ rm -rf vl72; git clone http://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git
Cloning into 'vl72'...
Username for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
Password for 'https://bitbucket.org': 
remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git/'
vlocity:/~/devel
vluser:$ rm -rf vl72; git clone http://bitbucket.org/VLCore/vl72.git
Cloning into 'vl72'...
remote: Counting objects: 71340, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (26903/26903), done.
remote: Total 71340 (delta 28047), reused 67522 (delta 25144)
Receiving objects: 100% (71340/71340), 37.18 MiB | 6.60 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (28047/28047), done.
Checking connectivity... done.


{code}

Anyone else having this issue?
fields.summary: Cloning and pulling on public repository via http asks for username and password

fields.description: Currently there's no feature that restricts users from creating branches. It'll be great to have that feature as an added security and to ensure correct process.
fields.summary: Customer Request: Restrict creation of branches to specific users within Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
It will be helpful if Safari's spellchecking/autocorrect feature does not affect the Repository Search/Filter feature on the Dashboard on Bitbucket.

!1895132335-Screen%20Shot%202016-05-12%20at%209.43.15%20PM.png|thumbnail!

For some users, there are are many repositories which aren't named after dictionary words, so autocorrecting the search terms on the filter can be quite annoying.

The current workaround is too disable spellcheck and autocorrect on Safari, but many users will rather not disable a useful feature, browser-wide, just because of one input on a specific URL.
fields.summary: Customer request: Disable Spell checking on the repository search/filter on Safari

fields.description:
Notice the difference between these URLs that are offered for the same file:

https://bitbucket.org/username/repository_name/commit_hash/webcam/README.md?at=master&fileviewer=file-view-default

and

https://github.com/username/repository_name/blob/master/webcam/README.md

See how the GitHub URL points directly to the most recent stable version of a file? This is excellent for documentation. Please add an option to "link to most recent version of this file"
fields.summary: Customer request: An option to link directly to the most recent version to a file - similar to Github.

fields.description:
The Pull Request code review screen often gets very long if there are a number of files in the PR. It would be nice to be able to collapse each file to move them out the way and so users can know which ones they've done already.

The opposite is already available, if there are too many files the ones at the end are collapsed, and are opened by clicking on them, it'll be great to be able to reverse that.
fields.summary: Customer Request: Collapse button on Pull Request Code Review
remote: error: unable to create temporary file: No space left on device

fields.description:
When calling the _changeset resource_ from the 1.0 API version the branch name is only returned for the latest commit.

This happens when using the _changeset resource_ to retrieve a [specific changeset|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/changesets-resource-296095208.html#changesetsResource-GETanindividualchangeset], if the hash is from a commit that *isn't* the latest one the branch information is always *null*.
fields.summary: Changeset resource returns null on branch

fields.description:
Perhaps this is too specific to my screen size, or I'm not seeing an easy workaround/setting (if not, please let me know).

My laptop resolution is 768 high, and when doing stuff on my Issues tracker, each time I want to get back to the main Issues page, I have to scroll down the left panel area to be able to see the "Issues" link (see attached screenshot, note that part of the navigation is out of view). It's a small (but repetitive) annoyance.

I had originally thought there would be a link to the main page in the breadcrumbs, or that the header / title below the breadcrumbs itself would itself be a link (fine if it's still black and just underlined on hover).
fields.summary: link page header that's below breadcrumbs

fields.description:
The new pull request listing (url : https://bitbucket.org/<account>/<project>/pull-requests/) is over complicated and very time consuming for our usage

Maybe it's usefull for some people so I wonder wether we can choose between the old and new design ? Or just bring the old design back plz
fields.summary: allow to use the old pull request view

fields.description: I was recently supriced that I wasn't able to drag/drop images from my word document (or any other copy/past text) into the description area. The only way this was possible is by saving images on local machine and then upload with the image add button.
fields.summary: Support drag and drop image upload in description area

fields.description:
Opera is not currently a supported browser by Bitbucket.

Some customers would like Bitbucket to add support for Opera.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to access bitbucket.org from Opera -- Customer Request

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/redcarpetup/desktop-ux/src/7babeeee6860ec9fa23c370a9a8451f61dd6d186/api/migrations/versions/3fc683355007_.py?at=recon_paid&fileviewer=file-view-default\\
this file exists.\\
However, this file gets removed in commit e1ba31c2747690e179de6ba08694c436ee6d75d2

I choose this commit in filehistory dropdown.

https://bitbucket.org/redcarpetup/desktop-ux/src/e1ba31c2747690e179de6ba08694c436ee6d75d2/api/migrations/versions/3fc683355007_.py?at=recon_paid  this is a 404 page "dead link"

What should happen is that in case of deadlink - it should go to changeset https://bitbucket.org/redcarpetup/desktop-ux/commits/e1ba31c2747690e179de6ba08694c436ee6d75d2?at=recon_paid and DISPLAY a MESSAGE saying that file was removed.
fields.summary: if file was removed, file-history-trigger dropdown shows "dead link"

fields.description:
The issue tracker warns users when they try to submit a comment containing only the string "+1" and offers them the choice to either submit the comment as-is or to discard the comment and submit a vote for the issue instead.

Current behaviour: When the user clicks the greyed out background outside the dialogue window, the comment is submitted as-is.

Expected behaviour: When the user clicks the greyed out background outside the dialogue window, the action is aborted and focus is returned to the comment text input.
fields.summary: Issue tracker "+1" confirmation dialogue should abort when the user clicks outside the dialogue window (BB-16094)

fields.description:
I have a list including the following:

* and for some reason i mention Csharp<generics>

For some reason the markdown parser picks up the T tag and messes up the rendering for things following the list. Every following line is indented to the right.
fields.summary: Incorrect markdown rendering when 'tags' are included

Should be possible to add a button 'Abandon Project' or something like it to users as I to choose to leave an specific project?

I had private repository without ability to make forks.\\
Than I tried to change the type of the repository to public and got "Public repositories must allow public forks" error message.\\
I changed Forking to "Allow forks" but got the same error message: "Public repositories must allow public forks".
fields.summary: Cannot make private repository public

fields.description:
Our Markdown guide states that “Markdown wraps a code block in both 
 and  tags.”. This doesn’t seems to be the case when I do a code block inside ordered or unordered lists and when the markdown file is displayed on your website. (Again, I followed here to put a code block inside a list: https://gist.github.com/clintel/1155906). When it’s displayed on your web site, the code block is wrapped in 
...
, resulting in multiple lines of code being displayed in one line. Other markdown to html tools rendered the correct html format. If I use browser’s dev tool to change 
 
to 
, it also displays correctly.
fields.summary: Markdown code block does not display correctly on site (BB-16056)

fields.description:
When trying to acccess the Atlassian Git LFS server with batch mode disabled, that is in .git/config there is a line

[lfs]\\
batch = false

, JWT authentication might fail with an error message like this:

Expecting claim 'qsh' to have value 'ae7000d663f8fd54188ee281c6cd2b993e14fc137edc388d08d983d4fba1cb72' but instead it has the value '2cc818a83a2278b909f968babd376ba9f710d9369c916f956f34b34a34c5e4e8'

Apparently the default for the batch option changed from git-lfs v0.52 to 0.60 (see https://github.com/github/git-lfs/blob/master/docs/api/http-v1-batch.md ). Due to this, this bug probably affects only old repositories that have the old default in their config or that specifically turned batch processing off.

Ideally Atlassians git-lfs implementation would implement both options. In case that's not feasible it would be helpful to have a better error message that gives a hint, that batch processing is not supported and the config should be changed.
fields.summary: Failing Git LFS authentication when batch mode is turned off

fields.description:
It would be helpful, both as a reviewer and a submitter to be able to distinguish which PR comments I have read (or not).

Similar to Fisheye/Crucible's behaviour with regards to comments in code reviews.
fields.summary: Visually distinguish PR comments that have not been read

Thanks & Cheers

fields.description:
I'm trying to do the following:

# Create a new repository under a "ExampleTeam" team
# Perform all the instructions of the empty repository
# When trying to perform the following command 'git push -u origin master' at the git client command line it gives the attached error.

In the error it claims that I do not have an email address associated with it. on the other hand when I go to the URL: https://bitbucket.org/account/user/isityou/email/ it says:\\
"Adding email addresses to teams is no longer supported"\\
So, it is misleading.

fields.description: A way to categorize or tag snippets, together with search, would make it a great way to start managing our team snippets. As it is, the lack of structure makes it useless.

I have create system to download zip from bitbucket repo and upload to aws lambda. But aws lambda need zip that flat out the top folder. While download zip from bitbucket contain a top folder in the same name as zip

There should be some option to make it flat. Currently now I need to write program just to decompress and recompress by myself

fields.description:
Diff panel is a great place to edit files and commit fixing

I would like to have ability to revert code and edit then submit a whole change in that page

Especially side by side diff panel should have arrow button to put code from old commit to new one. And could be edit code directly in the side of head commit

fields.description:
Folks,

I'm storing [the trunk of a WordPress repo|https://bitbucket.org/bmlt/bmlt-wordpress-plugin] on BitBucket.

WordPress mandates that the readme must be named "readme.txt". However, the BitBucket server won't interpret this as MarkDown (understandably).

I'd like to have a way to cast this file so that the repo will interpret it as MarkDown.
fields.summary: Can I Cast A readme.txt (WordPress Required Filename) to Markdown?

fields.description:
Bitbucket can strip changesets from the main repo from the Settings. But there's no way to strip changesets from Wiki repo.

Furthermore, there's no way to reset the Wiki. Even if you disable it, the content is still there. (And it's even accessible through Mercurial)

Please add "strip changeset" for Wiki repository too. The rationale is the same as with the main repo.
fields.summary: Strip changesets from Wiki

fields.description: after entering the repo name etc and submitting, the website only reloads.

fields.description:
Currently, one can click the {{+ New File}} button to create a new _text_ file, but what if one wants to upload an image to the repo (the actual git repo, not the wiki!)?

We are writing a text collaboratively using rst and Sphinx, but some of the co-authors do not have a git client installed and would like to upload images.
fields.summary: upload images (or: binary files) to the repo

fields.description:
###Summary\\
Account Notification is enabled but unable to receive email notification nor BB inbox notification when a repository access is granted to the user.

###Steps to Reproduce

# Go to *Bitbucket Settings>Notifications*
# Enable Email Notification
# Checked *My access to a repository or a team changing* option
# Use another Bitbucket account

## Create a repository
## Go to *Repository Settings>Access Management*
## Add the account with the Notification Enabled to the repository

###Expected Results###\\
Doesn't receive any email notification or Bitbucket Inbox Notification

###Actual Results###\\
User will receive Email Notification and Bitbucket Inbox Notification which indicate a repository is granted access to the user
fields.summary: After the repository access is granted, user doesn't receive any Email and BB inbox notification

fields.description:
I am trying to use the teams/member API:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/teams-endpoint-423626335.html#teamsEndpoint-GETtheteammembers

But I get 403.

For example https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/comalatech/members works without a problem, even for anon users, but if I try from within my addon I get the error
fields.summary: Teams REST API is not available to connect addons

fields.description: While support can help those that have gone over their limit with an immediate 'git gc' task, it would be optimal to have a feature that would allow the customer to schedule their own 'git gc' task on their repo after a cleanup. Possibly a button that will bring the task into a queue under the 'Admin' panel.

Pull takes forever

Counting objects: 41, done.\\
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.\\
Compressing objects: 100% (20/20), done.\\
Writing objects: 100% (21/21), 4.35 KiB, done.\\
Total 21 (delta 14), reused 0 (delta 0)\\

fields.description:
When viewing a pull request, you get a list of other users currently browsing the same page.

This strikes me as a bit too invasive. Users should be able to opt out of not having their browsing broadcast to others.

Please allow users to opt out of this feature:

# Do not notify other users of any page you are currently viewing.
# [optional] Do not show a list of users who are on the same page as you.
fields.summary: Allow opting out from "These users are viewing this PR right now"

fields.description:
Related to: BCLOUD-9436

It would be nice for users (post 2014 billing change) the ability to disable this feature completely, if we're not going to fix this anytime soon. Right now, showing customers the "Signup for another Atlassian service!" dialogue can be misleading and a pretty bad user experience.
fields.summary: Disable app switcher in Bitbucket (BB-16024)

fields.description:
I have received over nine hundred emails from BitBucket today.

All emails are notifications on spam issues from a single repository, runhello/test-sdl-crash. I finally made the repository private to stop the flood about twenty minutes ago. At that time I was receiving about ten emails from Bitbucket per minute, and Bitbucket was sending me so many emails so quickly that about twenty minutes after making the repository private, then removing its issue tracker, then unsubscribing to notifications from the repository, I am _still_ having straggling emails from bitbucket show up in my gmail.

I know that Atlassian is aware of the current spam attacks on BitBucket, and I know that the spam is not your fault. _However_, I think your software should be aware that if it is sending someone nearly a thousand emails in a day! — or ten in a minute—! Something is wrong. The spam attacks are not your fault but your software has reacted to the spam attacks very poorly.

I would like to suggest BitBucket add some combination of the following features:

* Some sort of flood detection where if you send more than a certain number of notification emails to a user over some reasonable amount of time, the emails either cut off or begin getting batched into several notifications per email.
* A batch mode where instead of sending one email per notification, you send one email per day with all notifications. Or one per hour? One per fifteen minutes?

I do not want to turn off email notifications from Bitbucket because the email notifications on my repositories are useful. But my personal email has been completely unusuable for days due to the spam attacks. If you cannot get things under control somehow I will have to cut off Bitbucket from sending me email :(
fields.summary: Your email notifications need flood protection

fields.description: For some reason it's not possible to delete a milestone from a ticket (aka setting to default value)
fields.summary: Cannot reset Milestone & Component anymore (BB-16055)

fields.description: I worked on a project which i do not longer have access, but it is still showing in recently updated list when somebody updates it. (I think because from watched list it was not removed automatically).
fields.summary: Recently updated

fields.description:
I can't remove repository from dashbord list, please remove it

!2627088108-Capture.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot remove repository from dashbord list

fields.description:
I received a comment on a commit

https://bitbucket.org/runhello/emily/commits/d2a2b9bf9195cdaa4eed8dd232e14cd550e6fabb#comment-3067908

The commit is literal gibberish. The account appears to be a throwaway. The account's "snippets" contain commercial spam.

Bitbucket exposes the ability to delete the comment. But it does not expose "report as spam" on the comment, as it does for issues. There is no way for me to report upstream that the account was causing a problem.

Expected behavior: Any user submitted comments that I can delete, I should be able to report as spam.
fields.summary: Cannot report comments as spam

fields.description:
Hello. I use the wiki feature on bitbucket. I like to keep the wikis public editable because it allows users to assist in documentation. However as described in issue BCLOUD-12624 I saw a spammer begin to attempt to use my wiki pages to host spam, so I have had to make the wikis private-edit. This is too bad because now it means users cannot help with the documentation any more.

The wikis are backed by mercurial and can be checked out and edited using mercurial. I would like to request that it be possible for a user to pull-request changes to wikis, so that users can still help with the wiki without the risk of defacement or spam possible. Currently you cannot fork a wiki and there's no way to use the pull request feature with a wiki.

I would like to note GitHub already offers this feature (because their equivalent of the public wikis is the gh-pages branch which the existing pull request feature can be used with).
fields.summary: Cannot pull request on wiki

fields.description:
I have a couple of repositories hosted on bit bucket with wikis. Here is an example:\\
https://bitbucket.org/runhello/jumpcore/wiki/Home\\
Up until a few minutes ago, the wiki for this site was public editable-- any bitbucket account could edit it.

A few minutes ago, a spammer created a junk page (they have also been hitting my issues and bitbucket technical support is already assisting me) named "(Delaware) (((1800+[snip])) QuickBooks Pro Support Phone Number .md" on the wiki. I quickly noticed, deleted their page and turned off public edits.

However because of this i noticed something. Their edits are forever in my wiki edit history. If I check out the hg backed repository, I can see in {{hg glog --style=compact}}:

{code}
@  38[tip]   283c3d2d2c61   2016-04-22 21:13 +0000   runhello <REDACTED>
|    Removed files via bitbucket
|
o  37   7fb6101a5bc1   2016-04-22 21:11 +0000   makbaldwin1 <makbaldwin1@usa-11.com>
|    Edited online
|
o  36   6fda7925433a   2014-10-06 15:34 +0000   runhello <REDACTED>
|    Edited online
{code}

The {{makbaldwin1}} edit is the bad one. I can still see its full contents using hg.

Because this is only one commit with one page, and it is just spam, this is not harmful. However I think this shows a feature limitation you should fix. Imagine: What if the edit had been harmful, for example posting someone's personal information? Then I would be stuck hosting that edit in the history of my bitbucket site forever. Or what if instead of one commit, it had been 400? Then the usefulness of my wiki would be restricted, because I would have to deal with those 400 commits every time I tried to edit my wiki using the mercurial interface.

A thing I notice: If this were a git repository and the wiki were backed by git, I could delete history from the wiki using {{git push -f}}. Similarly, if this were a source repository instead of a wiki-repository I could delete history in an emergency using the "strip changeset" feature. The "strip changeset" feature does not work for the wiki.

I think "strip changeset" should be available for hg-backed wikis.
fields.summary: Cannot delete from hg wiki history

fields.description:
I have a repository:

https://bitbucket.org/runhello/emily/issues?status=new&status=open&page=20

My repository has 483 open issues. It appears exactly two of them are legitimate issues posted by a user. The others are commercial spam, consisting of garbled names of commercial products and 800 numbers. The posts come from many different account names but the text is roughly the same for each. A nice person from Atlassian spoke to me last night on Twitter and deleted about 50 of these spam comments, but then at 1:30 PM today whoever is posting these increased their rate to about two per minute, leading to several hundred spam issues in a matter of three hours. I have turned off public issue posting in response.

However, now I have 481 spam comments in my queue. It takes about four clicks to report a single issue as spam, so that is about 1600 clicks and I do not know how much time to report all of them. I cannot do this.

Because your issue interface is a target for spam and has been for some time, I believe you need a mass delete / mass report feature. I do not know what this would look like, but both gmail and wordpress have features where there is a checkbox next to each post on a page, and you can "check all", uncheck the one or two legitimate posts, then "report/delete all".

Thanks.
fields.summary: Mass spam deletion tools needed (BB-16023)

fields.description:
"Below you'll see a list of this hooks latest requests." ==>

should be:

"Below you'll see a list of this hook's latest requests."
fields.summary: Grammatical error in webhooks request logs (BB-16022)

fields.description:
When passing the URL parameter to the build status api request, I would get a 400 BAD REQUEST error due to an "invalid" url. Our build server has a short name and we do not normally connect to it using a FQDN or IP address since it's easy to identify and remember. It would be nice if we could use a URL like:

https://example/path/to/build/info\\
instead of\\
https://example.com/path/to/build/info

Duplicate to issue BCLOUD-4240, which was closed due to inactivity
fields.summary: URL validation is too strict when using Build Status API

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:\\
A user completes Bitbucket sign-up\\
The user creates a repository\\
The user attempts to clone the repository using HTTPS

Expected: The user enters their username and password when prompted and is able to clone the repo.

Actual: The user enters their username and password when prompted and are given a 401

Workaround:\\
If the user logs out of Bitbucket and logs back in using our login form with their Atlassian account email and password, it will reset the password hash on their account and fix the issue.

Alternative workaround:\\
Use the "Forgot Password" form at id.atlassian.com - it will also set the password hash and fix the issue.
fields.summary: New users are unable to push over HTTPS. (BBCDEV-863)

fields.description:
For some reason, adding a user to a group, or adding a group to a user will not work.

When the */admin/groups/view?name=developers* page first loads, there is a post to the following resource which fails:

"NetworkError: 403 Forbidden - https://mydomain.com:8083/rest/webResources/1.0/resources"\\
*XSRF check failed*

Then when I submit the form to add a user to the group, it fails with the same status (403) and message: *XSRF check failed*

The atl_token is not submitted with the ajax requests, even though it is submitted on other pages. Post data only contains:

{code}
#!json
{"group":"developers","users":["bob"]}

{code}

Bitbucket v4.3.2\\
Tested on FireFox and Chrome

Requests are on:\\
https://mydomain.com:8083  (port open on firewall)

In the apache httpd.conf, we accept the request using a Comodo SSL certificate (works fine).  We then forward the request to Bitbucket listening on port 7990

{code}
    ProxyPreserveHost On
    ProxyRequests Off
    ProxyPass / http://localhost:7990/
    ProxyPassReverse / http://localhost:7990/
{code}

Most of the other bitbucket admin pages work fine over https:  sign in, saving server settings, etc.  I confirmed that the browser is sending the HTTP referrer.

I am not sure why the "add user to group" page does not send the CSRF token. Even when I craft an ajax post with the token in the query string and/or the post data, it still gives a CSRF failure.
fields.summary: CSRF token not sent by javascript when adding users to groups

fields.description:
Right now, you can only create a wiki for a repository.\\
When creating a project, it's often useful to have a shared wiki, as articles will likely deal with more than one repository. And it's also nice to have documentation in one place.
fields.summary: Wiki per project, instead of per repository

fields.description:
This issue bears similarity to issue BCLOUD-12073, but is more significant because it is regarding work that needs to be done on an unmarked PR. I am waiting on feedback from a teammate on work I'm doing. He had wanted me to rework the code in a different way and there were 3 related tasks for doing it.  I did the first one, which I assume made the 3 tasks linked to a "prior version" of the code.  When I comment on the second task, I want my teammate to respond, but when I try to tag him, the comment window disappears.  Here's a screenshot:

!1778400918-Screen%20Shot%202016-04-20%20at%204.30.38%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Tagging a user in a reply to a comment on an open task in an unmerged PR in the "Comments on prior versions" window makes the window disappear

browser stays on same page no errors or warnings swown
fields.summary: Can't fork repository

fields.description:
###Summary\\
When a user downloads a file on the Issues page, the file extension of the downloaded file changed. This issue only happens on Chrome.

###Tested Environment

* Hg and git repository
* Private Repository with private issue tracker
* Chrome (49.0.2623.112)

###Steps to Reproduce

# Create an issue in the Issue Page
# Attach files with different file extension
# Click 'Create Issue'
# Download each of the files

List of file extension tested:\\
(.sub, .vmg, .text, .ass, .asc, .xml, .log, .xlog, .ris, .klg, .conf, .java, .bin, .rar, .png, .xlsx)

###Expected Results###\\
The downloaded file should have the same file extension

###Actual Results###\\
The file extension changed to .txt when download .conf, .log and .asc file.\\
Some machine download file with .sql instead of .txt

###Workaround###

# Use another browser (Firefox and Microsft Edge)
# Right click on the file and click "Save link as...". Then change the file extension
fields.summary: File extension changed after downloading a file from Issue page (BB-16050)

fields.description:
Hi,

Please could you add a feature to do one *(or both)* of the following:

h1. Request Feature 1
Add a setting in the repository settings toggle on/off: {{Limit Tagged users to Private Repository Members}} which would prevent anyone who isn't a part of that repository from appearing in the autocomplete list.

For example if you type {{@bil}} as you can see in my screenshot below, it will not show {{@bil}} as an option, it would only show {{@bil_bas}}. Default Repository Setting: False (off)

!http://i.imgur.com/ftNmiMD.png!

In regards to my first suggestion, the support staff said this is slightly different to what has been requested over at: BCLOUD-6092

To me it looks like it was "fixed" BCLOUD-6672 but clearly in my screenshot it's not working.

----
h1. Request Feature 2
Add a page in the repository settings for {{Tagging Alias's}}, this would allow you to set any/multiple "tag" phrases to automatically convert to tag a specific user. It would be good to allow the "tag" alias to allow regex too for more advanced users who want to cover various names with 1 rule.

For example, it would allow you to setup: {{@Bil}} as an alias of {{@bil_bas}}. Now when you type {{@Bil}} and submit a post (even in public repositories) this *would not tag* the user behind {{@bil}} instead it would override and tag {{@bil_bas}}

This could allow people to also setup alias's like: {{@core}} which would tag the manager/lead "core" developer instead of having to type their @username.

----
Note: This falls under usability, repository administration and even teams. I filed it as usability because it's a pain tagging the wrong user over and over again when the person(s) I tag aren't even a member of my repository.

Thanks
fields.summary: Prevent tagging incorrect users via @user auto-complete for repositories (BB-16045)
Creating branches with # symbol will not link correctly in commits page

fields.description: Surely these should be High and Low respectively? Or perhaps the Priority field should be labelled severity instead.
fields.summary: "Major Priority" and "Minor Priority" do not make sense

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The merge destination of the repository of a Team unable to add reviewers on a pull request created by other forked repository.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a feature that would allow the Team of the destination repository to add reviewers to the pull request that created by another user who forked from the repository.

This feature will allow the Team have more control over their repository

h3. Current Workaround
Request the owner of the forked repository to

# add the reviewers into the pull request
# grant you with the repository write access at _Repo Settings>Access Management_
fields.summary: Customer Request : Allow repository owner to add reviewer to a fork pull request

fields.description:
As a great man once said:

bq. It would be very useful to have an option to set the default value for priority the same way you set default values for components, milestones and versions.


But [that got closed because we didn't whinge enough|BCLOUD-6150] and there's no way to re-open it so I'm recreating it.

And yes, I ironically left the priority as major, even though it probably should be a minor thing.

<3
fields.summary: Customizable default priority for issue reporting

fields.description:
When an author creates a Pull Request, reviewers get notified with the Author and respective PR in the e-mail. However, upon additional approvals/comments for the open PR, reviewers are notified via e-mail with the details related to PR activity. However, it'd be nice to have author details when an e-mail is triggered for the PR.

Currently, when a PR is created, author info is available. However, further additional updates does not provide author info.
fields.summary: Include author details in all pull request notifications (not just the create notification)

fields.description:
Whenever I start {{git push}}, it takes up to twenty seconds for the passphrase prompt to show up. Every SSH connection with {{bitbucket.org}} seems to hang for a very long time after

{code}
debug1: sending SSH2_MSG_KEX_ECDH_INIT
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_ECDH_REPLY
{code}

and eventually continues without problems.

My ping with {{bitbucket.org}} is about 125 ms, which seems normal for the distance (traceroute reports 30 ms between my house to my ISP, the Atlantic Ocean incurs an 80-90 ms increase, and everything else is just details). I doubt that bandwidth is an issue for this specific scenario, because the delay only happens as the SSH connection is negotiated, and the actuall pull/push traffic is fast.
fields.summary: SSH slow to connect

The "Prevent deletion of these branches" section of the "Branch Management" page produces the below javascript error when a new branch is added and does not refresh the branch list. Items are added and visible on refresh however.

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'replace' of undefined
fields.summary: Adding new branch restrictions fails in the UI (BB-16003)

reStructuredText Error (BB-12551) reopened

fields.description:
Something that i'm finding extremely frustrating with many code review tools is that there are just too many files in the list (example: github will truncate and give up if there are more than x number of files). This feature request is for bitbucket's recently mentioned improved code review tools to allow filtering of the files being displayed in the diff.\\
ideally i'd like to key in on specific source files based on file type or a wildcard, or combination of the two. *.h, *.m *.swift and not include things like *.png, *.jpg, *.strings.\\
Thanks!
fields.summary: Filter pull request file list by file type

fields.description:
In other bugtrackers I have often see issues get automatically closed after they have been in some "needsInfo" or similar status (waiting for a reply or additional information from the original poster). That is already wrong, but at least it makes some amount of sense.

But in this bugtracker I have just witnessed the most stupid thing ever. An *OPEN* issue gets automatically closed "*due to inactivity*" after a year of... well, inactivity.

An issue that has been reported, with all the necessary information to understand and fix it, why the hell should it be closed "because" nothing has happened in a year?? That you haven't fixed it in a year isn't by any means a reason for closing it. If anything, it should be a reason to give it more attention.

It's f***ing ridiculous.
fields.summary: Issues are automatically closed after a year of inactivity, even if not fixed

fields.description:
I'd love to see ahead/behind info when fetching branches via the API.

Basically, what you see here: {{https://bitbucket.org/{owner}/{repo_slug}/branches/}}

Use case:

I want to merge a branch when responding to a webhook on a remote repo only if the branch is exactly 1 commit ahead, and 0 commits behind.
fields.summary: Expose Ahead/Behind info

fields.description:
Feature Request is to add a setting to define what the default repository to open pull requests against.  This is especially helpful for novel uses of forks.

For example, in my use case we have a fork of a legacy software that receives updates and patches.  Since this project does not utilize dependency management, we fork this copy of it's base code and make our modifications for each individual project to that.

99.99% of the time when we want to make a pull request on one of these projects it is against it's own fork and not the master fork.  However the default in bitbucket is to open the pull request against the master fork.

That's quite a logical default but is very annoying when it cannot be modified.

Therefore my request is to add a setting to set the default project for opening pull requests against.

Tangentially related to my previous request, BCLOUD-11283 (BB-13552)
fields.summary: Add setting to define default repository to open pull requests against

fields.description: Similar to the dashboard repository list, you should be able to click on any of the headers to sort the list.
fields.summary: Custom sort options for profile repository list (BB-16000)

fields.description:
In the Pull Requests screen, the filters are "Aberto", "Mescaldo" and "Regeitado". The typo is in "Regeitado" with "G" instead of "J", the correct is "Rejeitado".

This also shows up in the page with details about the pull request after it is rejected.
fields.summary: Fix a typo in brazilian portuguese

fields.description:
A bit of a follow-up to BCLOUD-5652 using the ability to pass build results over the API from our CI servers.

I'd like to see a successful build requirement on a pull request before it can be merged. This will greatly help in actually enforcing successful tests before something is deployed to a production branch.

Note that this might be more complicated than it first looks. I do not want it to just be rejected if there is a failed build, because if I have multiple build configurations configured for a branch and not all of them have completed, the lack of failure doesn't mean anything. In other words, the ideal solution would be specifying the names (or IDs) of build configurations that explicitly have to finish with a successful state before merging is possible.

This should of course always be enforced on the latest commit in a pull request. If a previous commit had all successful builds but there is a new commit that is awaiting new builds, the entire pull request is currently still marked as successful, which isn't technically correct. Especially for this use case, the enforcement should always happen on the latest commit (since that is the state that matters for merging).
fields.summary: Require successful builds before pull requests can be merged

fields.description:
Currently in push commit mail notifications the following info is present:\\
*Author*, *Commit*, *Message*, *Date*.

It would be great to also see *Branch* name for pushed commits.

For mail filtering it would be especially useful to see branch name in mail *subject*.
fields.summary: Add branch name to push commit mail notifications

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be nice to be able to specify the project for a repository created via the API.

Via the API calls, you can GET that data but it seems you cannot PUSH it when creating a new repo.

Ta,\\
David.
fields.summary: Create a Repository via the API and set the Project

fields.description:
Commit date should show exact date and time instead of Facebook like "x time ago". Most of the time, I need to see exact date and time of a commit.\\
For me Bitbucket is a power-tool, not a fancy thing.

At least you should make date format configurable.
fields.summary: Show absolute date + time for commits instead of relative

fields.description:
Steps:

# Be part of a Team
# The team should have a project that you only have read in
# Have a repo in said project (cant be created by you since you only have read access :( )
# Fork this repo into the project from step 2

Now you have a fork of a project that you cant write to even though you created it
fields.summary: Create Repos in projects you only have read access in (BB-16161)

fields.description:
Can we get this functionality as it will really help automate our workflows.

Github has this:

Merging - https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/merging/#perform-a-merge\\
Create branch - https://developer.github.com/v3/git/refs/#create-a-reference
fields.summary: Branch creating and merging via API

fields.description:
Either 1 of 2 things should be possible.

# Allow per repo keys, not just read only deployment keys, but write also as an option, of course with an associated accountable user. This is manly for server automated pushing, as a grant of push on user keys opens up a worm exploit security risk, as all repos are writable from more than the necessary subset of key locations.
# Or each user key also has restrictions on it so for example admin on the key and admin on the user is needed to obtain admin rights. This option has more security implications.
fields.summary: Per key Access rights (BB-16004)

fields.description:
It would be awesome if branches and tags (especially tags) are sorted naturally...

*Current*

* v0.1
* v0.10
* v0.2

*Wanted*

fields.summary: Semantic sorting for tags/branches

fields.description:
It would be nice if a commit detail page has a link "View in tree" that highlights the current commit within the tree on whatever page it's located.

Saves us time spending on searching _some_ commit where it's located in the tree (due pagination)
fields.summary: View commit in tree

fields.description:
At this moment, if we want to see which project are public and which are private, we have to enter into each project's settings to check this.

It would be ideal if we can filter projects per its status: public or free so we can quickly know which projects are public.
fields.summary: Filter project by public or private

fields.description:
Hi,

My team manages a lot of repositories and we appreciate the project feature to regroup repositories. I was wondering whether you are planning to give the possibility to manage access rights by project? It really would help.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Project level access management
